title: 111_hr3328
content: The Act may be cited as the "Gandhi-King Scholarly Exchange Initiative Act of 2009". Congress acknowledges the peaceful leadership and dedication of Mahatma Gandhi and Martin Luther King, Jr. in promoting civil rights, social justice, and non-violent movements. Gandhi's use of satyagraha inspired many in the fight for civil and social rights. In 2009, a congressional delegation traveled to India to commemorate Martin Luther King, Jr.'s pilgrimage in 1959 and study Gandhi's principles for peaceful conflict resolution. Richard Holbrooke also visited India to discuss peace and stability in Afghanistan and South Asia. According to the 2009 Global Peace Index by the Institute for Economics and Peace, global violence in 2007 cost $4.8 billion in lost business and $7.2 billion in expenses, highlighting the economic benefits of peace. SEC. 3. GANDHI-KING SCHOLARLY EXCHANGE INITIATIVE. The Secretary of State is authorized to establish the Gandhi-King Scholarly Exchange Initiative with the Government of India. It includes educational and professional exchange programs, such as an annual forum focusing on the legacies of Mahatma Gandhi and Martin Luther King, Jr. held alternately in the United States and India. The Gandhi-King Scholarly Exchange Initiative focuses on studying Gandhi and King's work and applying their philosophies to current issues like poverty, conflict, human rights, civil rights, peace, nonviolence, and democracy in the US and India. It includes a professional development training initiative for government employees to develop international conflict solutions based on nonviolence principles. Targeting employees in countries with ongoing conflicts, it is developed in consultation with key officials and partners. The Gandhi-King Scholarly Exchange Initiative includes a curriculum for teaching conflict resolution, a student exchange program to study the legacies of Martin Luther King, Jr. and Mahatma Gandhi, and research opportunities on the importance of nonviolent movements in conflict resolution. The curr_chunk discusses the definition of "United States cooperating partners" as institutions of higher education, including historically Black colleges and universities and Hispanic-serving institutions. The curr_chunk defines "United States cooperating partners" as institutions of higher education, including historically Black colleges and universities, Hispanic-serving institutions, and nongovernmental organizations. SEC. 4. REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. The Secretary of State must submit a report on the plan for the initiative within 120 days of the Act's enactment. Periodic updates will be provided upon request. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Authorization of appropriations for the Secretary of State to carry out the Act for fiscal years 2010 through 2015.
